title: Junior Data Scientist
text:
junior data scientist - adlib software - job board go to our website » « go back to job listings junior data scientist location: burlington, ontario, canada department: r&d type: full time min. experience: entry level at adlib, we are redefining the future of content management. we've displaced gorillas in the market with a focus on customer service and success. we are adding to our suite of offerings, building a new product with a unique approach to data insights. like most tech companies, adlib started small, in response to a problem our co-founders experienced as business leaders. they recognized a need for rapidly generated solutions to leverage the value in unstructured data. but unlike most tech companies, those original co-founders continue to be directly involved in the daily operations of the company as ceo, vp r&d and vp customer success. they've built adlib on three pillars of strength that measure our success: product innovation. we build up from our roots, improvising - adlibbing - solutions to client document and data management problems. customer relationships. we have a dedicated focus on creating a positive customer experience that stands out from everyone else. truly engaged and passionate team. that's where you come in. who you are you are obsessed with solving big data problems and determining value of dark data. you want to be fully immersed in an r&d role where you can push the boundaries of knowledge and innovate new solutions to be patented. you are looking for a role where you can leverage your knowledge and our technologies to give meaning and make decisions around unstructured data. you want to use research, natural language processing, machine learning and artificial intelligence to solve data science challenges. you want an opportunity to drive forward the creation of algorithms that will become part of the adlib elevate platform and have a significant impact on thousands of organizations across the globe. there are very few roles like this one out there. our new jr. data scientist will work with: big data. collect, ingest, store and analyze large datasets from structured and unstructured data. transform and convert unstructured dataset into structured data products. best practices. identify and evaluate standardized methods, best practices, models and algorithms to solve the problems. machine learning. research and develop new machine learning techniques and algorithms to address needs. train and build machine learning models to meet goals. experiments. test and validate the solutions. apply the latest technologies in modeling and data mining to the the experiments insights. use data mining techniques and build statistical models to classify and perform data extraction from content. knowledge sharing. document methods and algorithms used in solutions. you will: collaborate. work closely with engineering colleagues to design, build and test new and improved solutions. our new jr. data scientist has: phd in computer science or related field such as mathematics or statistics proven track record of delivering high quality analytics insights and solutions on unstructured data practical expertise using: clustering, regression and classification machine learning techniques data visualization tools distributed big data stores (e.g. hadoop or others) working with tb+ scale datasets statistical modeling, data mining, pattern recognition and search ranking experience designing machine learning pipeline expert knowledge of algorithms and data structures   strong programming skills: python, java, .net or equivalent experience designing, conducting, analyzing and interpreting experiments outstanding critical thinking, creativity, communication and problem solving skills why join adlib? our employees, new and not-so-new, tell us we excel at transparency and work-life balance. and while those may be buzzwords used to attract attention, we actually live them. how do we know this? a significant portion of our team has been here for longer than 10 years. in the tech industry, that's rare. we have people who leave and come back because they miss the culture and our team spirit. but, having said that, we aren't perfect at everything. we're continuously working on change management - we've lost count of how many whiteboards we have. we don't have all of the processes we'd like to, but that means that this is the place to get your hands dirty, come up with your own processes and work without a net. while this might be common in silicon valley, in the suburbs of toronto, it's rare and greatly appreciated to have an open-vacation policy and to promote employee wellness. we have massage therapist days, badminton, baseball, fresh fruit in the lunchroom and fitness membership reimbursement. our burlington, ontario location translates to minimal commute time and maximum family time and productivity time. if you aren't stuck in traffic, worried about being late for a professional or personal commitment, life is just less stressful and work is more enjoyable. adlib software is revolutionizing the way organizations think about their content, join us to be part of that change. apply now or follow us on twitter, facebook or linkedin. adlib seeks to inspire and nurture the human spirit - we understand that each person brings a distinct life experience to the table. embracing diversity not only enhances our work culture but drives business success. adlib encourages applications from everybody, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) privacy & terms
human check* « go back to job listings apply for this position * required fields apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* location phone number* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter* in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye!*   this frame prevents back/forward cache problems in safari.

overview:   the performance analysis consultant is an expert/advisory level position. as performance analysis consultant – customer 360 insights within the journey design & delivery team, this candidate will be reporting to manager, c360 insights. the candidate will be responsible for providing actionable customer insights to resolve strategic and tactical marketing issues by building advanced statistical models using sas, sql and other data mining tools. the role would be expected to provide thought-leadership in researching new modeling techniques/solutions to solve complex marketing issues. along with the manager, c360 insights, the candidate will co-lead the integration of customer insights into telus’ omni channel marketing strategy to enable better decisions that drive revenue/ebitda growth, manage churn and reduce customer effort across various lines of business.   responsibilities:  strategies and planning:  assist the manager, c360 insights to cultivate a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture inside and outside the marketing department and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling process to gain operational efficiency assist the manager, c360 insight to identify business issues through analytics; provide actionable insights and influence business partners to take action based on analytical/modeling insights   thought leadership and teamwork:  contribute to the ongoing development of the team by sharing information, success, lessons learned of own project work collaboratively with marketing primes to develop modelling requirements and prioritization; present model results and actionable recommendations to internal business clients and senior leadership mentors junior team members from a technical as well as business acumen perspective assist the manager, c360 insights to drive for the cultivation of a hybrid culture (analytics and business) to share insights/learnings to demonstrate value of big data analytics and investments to business partner teams (data - insights - strategy - results)   day-to-day portfolio/deliverable management:  contribute to the development of the omni channel strategy by developing near real-time predictive models and trigger based strategies leveraging sas/sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, python, r, etc work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces develop analytical blueprint to solve compartmentalized business issues and assembly to the big picture solution present customer insights to cross functional business partners including marketing, channel, products & services, customer experience and digital own the end-to-end development of campaign targeting through analytics and building propensity models/response models using various multivariate modelling/data mining techniques   expert knowledge:  be recognized as the top expert in predictive modeling, data mining, r&d within telus educate, advocate and advise cross-functional business partners at team member level in advanced analytics and predictive modeling maintain a solid and updated knowledge in the predictive modeling, data mining field including applications of big data, text analytics, social network analytics, cross channel modelling   qualifications required knowledge:  business orientation:  advanced business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills; ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis strong ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables advanced written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of microsoft office suite   technical expertise:  advanced knowledge in various advanced predictive modeling/data mining techniques to ensure effective solutions to marketing issues extensive hands-on experience in sas (or sas enterprise guide), sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, r, python, sql and other data query language on unix/pc and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills    required skills & abilities:  change management: self-driven individual with ability to adapt to varying business environments and effectively drive business results by leveraging analytics mentorship: strong leadership, coaching, mentoring skills  required professional designation/certification:  phd in statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field is preferred master’s degree with extensive relevant experience and knowledge will be strongly considered  required experience:  10+ years of related predictive modeling experience, preferably in marketing telecom/industry experience would be beneficial credit risk modeling experience will be considered  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

job description


ibm global business services: join a leader. consult with us.ibm global business services helps top-tier clients solve their most complex business and technical issues. as a data scientist, you will deliver innovative business consulting, business process design, systems integration, and application design and management to leading sector organizations in 17 industries worldwide. with access to resources that only a global leader can provide, you will learn valuable skills, gain access to a vast and diverse network of talented professionals, and enjoy unparalleled career, training, and educational opportunities.visit http://www.ibm.com/ca/ for more informationthe data scientist will be familiar with key internal and external data sources and how they are gathered and retrieved; experience with manipulation large volumes of data leveraging hadoop and open source technologies is essential. the incumbent will be experienced with various languages and tools and able to select a suitable tool for the analytics solution or working with data.in addition to broad and deep data and analytics skills, the data scientist has strong business acumen, coupled with the ability to communicate findings to both business and it leaders in a way that can influence how an organization approaches a business challenge. incumbents also advise on and select the business problems that have the most value for the organization.a successful candidate must have hands-on experience working with advanced analytics (spss, sas, r) and hadoop big data ecosystem (hdfs, map/reduce, hive, hbase, sqoop, etc.), with an understanding of the following:data mining and business problem definition (experience with crisp dm or similar methodology)analytical and quantitative conceptsmachine learning techniquesdemonstrated ability to learn new tools and solutions quickly

text:
description de l'emploi - data scientist (ds-200917-001-fs)allez à la section du contenu principal.bienvenue. vous n'êtes pas connecté(e)|mes options de comptemon panier|connexionl'accès à ce service est coupé automatiquement après {0} minutes d'inactivité. votre session se terminera dans {1} minutes.cliquez sur ok pour réinitialiser le minuteur à {0} minutes.votre session est terminée.l'accès à ce service est coupé automatiquement après {0} minutes d'inactivité.recherche d'emploismes activitésrecherche de base|recherche avancée|toutes les offresdébut de la section du contenu principal.revenir à la page d'accueilformat imprimable  description de l'emploi - data scientist (ds-200917-001-fs)  data scientist (numéro de l'emploi : ds-200917-001-fs)  groupe bnp paribas bnp paribas possède des succursales dans 75 pays et se targue d’avoir plus de 185 000 employés, dont près de 145 000 en europe. le groupe détient des positions clés dans ses deux grands domaines d’activité : retail banking & services (comprenant domestic markets et international financial services) et corporate & institutional banking. en europe, le groupe dessert quatre marchés intérieurs (la belgique, la france, l’italie et le luxembourg). bnp paribas personal finance est le chef de file du crédit à la consommation. bnp paribas développe également son modèle intégré de banque de détail dans les pays du bassin méditerranéen, en turquie et en europe de l’est et a un réseau important dans l’ouest des états-unis. dans ses activités corporate & institutional banking et international financial services, bnp paribas bénéficie d’un leadership en europe, d’une forte présence dans les amériques, ainsi que d’un dispositif solide et en forte croissance en asie-pacifique.
 
à propos de bnp paribas corporate and institutional banking pleinement intégrée au groupe bnp paribas, bnp paribas corporate and institutional banking (cib) est un important fournisseur de solutions destinées à deux types de clientèle, à savoir les entreprises et les institutions, et exerce ses activités partout en emoa (europe, moyen-orient et afrique), en apac (asie-pacifique) et dans les amériques. la banque est un chef de file mondial sur le marché des capitaux d’emprunt et des instruments dérivés. elle fait partie des plus grandes institutions européennes sur les marchés du capital de risque et détient des franchises de premier plan en financement spécialisé. dans les services en valeurs mobilières, elle compte parmi les cinq premières institutions en importance au monde. bnp paribas cib s’est donnée pour mission de desservir le marché mondial en fournissant un éventail de solutions à ses clients : financement (marchés du capital de risque, marchés des capitaux d’emprunt, financement spécialisé), banque de flux (financement commercial et gestion de trésorerie), services-conseils financiers (fusion et acquisition, financement de projets), marchés mondiaux (taux d’intérêt, crédit, opérations de change, instruments dérivés sur actions), gestion de risques et services en valeurs mobilières.
www.cib.bnpparibas.com
 
description générale le programme d’innovation est sous la responsabilité de l’équipe de la transformation et s’occupe de la gestion et de la coordination de la stratégie d’innovation pour la région des amériques. le programme d’innovation sera une plateforme pour innover et mettre en œuvre des idées qui influencent positivement nos activités et remettent en question le statu quo de l’organisation.sous l’égide du programme d’innovation, un nouveau laboratoire a pour but de soutenir cib dans les amériques et de maximiser la compréhension des clients, des produits, des services et des opérations, ainsi que d'accroître le repérage des occasions à partir de données, de l’innovation et de la conception de produits.les scientifiques de données feront partie d’une équipe centralisée et aideront les dirigeants du laboratoire à analyser les problèmes ou occasions commerciaux et à les résoudre à l’aide d’une analyse approfondie des données. ce poste apportera des méthodes d’analyse et statistiques rigoureuses pour améliorer l’expérience des clients, la stratégie marketing, l’efficacité de la plateforme et l’expérience des employés.
 
responsabilités 
agir à titre d’expert central pour les analyses de données, et constituer une force pour sa mise en œuvre dans bnp paribas dans les amériques :
• découvrir des répétitions cachées dans les données de bnp paribas dans les amériques pour générer de nouvelles occasions de marché et une expérience client améliorée. • appliquer différents modèles statistiques pour trouver les répétitions et effectuer une analyse prévisionnelle afin d'améliorer l’information acquise.• partager ses connaissances sur les tendances technologiques et commerciales pour donner des conseils sur les répercussions et avantages potentiels.• explorer les occasions d’évaluation des données par une analyse améliorée et concevoir/développer des produits à partir des données. • traduire l’information tirée des données en outils et solutions exploitables par les entreprises comme des sources de données centralisées sous une seule interface visuelle, des outils de prévision intelligents, des outils de direction commerciale, des améliorations à la qualité des produits orientés clients de bnp paribas, etc.• assister les initiatives des ti et donner des conseils et des recommandations pour apporter des améliorations le cas échéant.
bnpprsr   compétences minimales requises
• maîtrise en sig, science informatique, statistiques, mathématiques ou autre domaine lié aux ti. un doctorat est un atout.
• au moins 3-5 années d’expérience de travail pertinente (p. ex. : comme statisticien, scientifique de données, bio-informaticien), y compris une grande expertise et expérience en analyse des données statistiques. des travaux d’analyse en dehors des travaux en classe pendant les études peuvent être inclus.
• expertise dans l’analyse des données, science des données et visualisation des données.
• expérience de développement dans un ou plusieurs des principaux langages de programmation analytiques (python, java, c++, etc.).
• expertise dans l’application d’algorithmes d’apprentissage machine (agrégation, réseaux neuronaux, etc.).
• expérience dans l’utilisation de techniques mathématiques pour découvrir des tendances commerciales et pour résoudre des problèmes commerciaux et les traduire en recommandations.
• aptitudes démontrées dans la sélection des bons outils pour résoudre un problème d’analyse des données. 
• excellentes aptitudes de communication verbale et écrite et capacité d’interagir avec professionnalisme. 
• très grande conscience professionnelle; aptitude à traiter les informations confidentielles.

qualifications supplémentaires 
• connaissance des technologies des mégadonnées (hdfs, spark, drill, etc.) un atout.
• capacité d’adaptation rapide à de nouvelles situations et gestion de projets dans un environnement de travail dynamique.
• capacité à dépasser les cadres préétablis en suggérant de nouvelles idées pertinentes pour les clients ou l’organisation.
 
 
une politique de recrutement qui favorise l’équité et la diversité
parce qu’elles favorisent la créativité et l’efficacité, qui sont entre autres sources d’une meilleure performance et d’une plus grande productivité, l’équité et la diversité font partie intégrante de notre politique de recrutement. nous nous efforçons de refléter la société qui nous entoure et d’être à l’image de nos clients.
la règle de non-discrimination s’applique à chacun de nos recrutements. 
nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidats choisis qui répondent aux exigences du poste en matière de formation et d’expérience.
bnpprsr lieu principal: ca-qc-montréaltype d'emploi: cdidomaine d'activité: informatique - secteur d’activité: cib - corporate bankingniveau d'etudes: master ou équivalent (> 4 ans)niveau d'expérience: au moins 3 anshoraire: temps plein

title: 
                        
data scientist
                        










 
requisition id: 1900
the digital factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. we have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward.
do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? at the scotiabank digital factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience.
we’re looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done.
by joining our team, you will make an impact on our customers, the banking industry, and ultimately, the world.
 
 
overview
there has never been a better time to join scotiabank as a data scientist. the data scientist role in the applied analytics team at scotiabank is designed for individuals with a curiosity for deriving insights out of data and applying them to address business opportunities.
 
what’s in it for you?

placement in a bootcamp to introduce candidates to the world of data science at scotiabank
exposure to different business lines where analytics techniques are being applied
assignment in hands-on practical projects which provide an opportunity to gain new knowledge and develop skills
ongoing training and learning program with resources like books, conferences and networking with subject matter experts at analytics user groups organized by decision sciences
a compensation program with competitive salary, opportunities for annual performance incentives based on performance thresholds, a competitive benefits program and continuing education programs. 

 
responsibilities:

collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging data science
ingest massive volumes of structured and unstructured format data, model, transform and store it in variety of data stores
leverage distributed computing tools (e.g. spark, hadoop) for analysis, data mining and modeling
collaborate with data engineering and operational teams to deploy models and algorithms in production, across different channels and customer platforms
create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure conduct multi-variate testing and a/b testing to measure effectiveness of models and make ongoing changes
prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes

 
requirements:

university degree in relevant stem discipline (computer sciences, electrical/computer/software engineering, mathematics)
experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, xml, json, flat files, audio, image)
hands-on experience with big data ecosystem tools (e.g., hive, pig, sqoop, spark, kafka) and experience with nosql databases (e.g., hbase, cassandra, druid)
production experience with experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning and predictive modeling (e.g., cross-sell, upsell, attrition, acquisition and lookalike models)
programming skills in java, c++ or python
experience with common machine learning libraries in r, python, spark
experience with unix tools and shell scripting
solid sql skills for querying relational databases (e.g., sql server, db2, mysql)
experience using and implementing visualization tools like d3, tableau or qlikview

 
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto

what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province data scientist equitysim - toronto, on who we arejoin a small, dynamic team that crushes it on a daily basis. our vision is to create simulation technology that promotes fairness in the hiring processes of all industries. so far, we've built and launched a simulator for the finance industry that can evaluate and place candidates based on their investment strategies. this simulator takes the form of a web platform and extensive backend database of student information and trades.we are headquartered in san francisco, california and like to work hard while having fun. we were recently a member of batch 20 at the 500 startups accelerator program and have successfully raised our seed round of funding. we are still in very early stages, so everyone we employ is very high-impact and needs to make essential decisions on a daily basis.the positioncurrently we are looking for exceptional candidates to join our san francisco, toronto and vancouver offices.we're looking for someone who is comfortable performing in an extremely fast-paced and impactful position. you must be very comfortable owning projects and data and carrying this responsibility. you must also be a very good communicator and be able to set and meet deadlines in an extremely efficient manner.you'll be expected to work with the ceo and technical teams to make improvements to our recruiting algorithm. you'll also work with our data to draw conclusions on user performance, retainability, and other kpis that drive business decisions and the company direction.we're looking for you to use your experience to help integrate new artificial intelligence algorithms into our production software. other responsibilities include:determining what data to collect (and how) to enable us to model expected student performance in the most accurate way possiblefind new ways to track actual behaviors and performance, and compare that to the expected resultsclearly show data comparisons in a transparent manner to draw and support conclusionsworking across technical, sales, and product teams to build and maintain experiments and algorithmsown and improve our most proprietary business algorithmsdetermine the best data collection tools to use, and drive their implementationwho you arean experienced data analyst or scientist with a master's degree in an analytical field, such as computer science, engineering, mathematics, and statistics). we like to see people with interesting, unexpected backgrounds. we're building something totally new and disruptive, so you should appreciate innovation - and all the benefits (and costs) that come with it.specifically, you'll need the following qualifications to succeed:master's degree in an analytical fieldgood personality, willing to work with other good personalities2+ years experience working with scripting languages (python preferred)2+ years of sql experience2+ years of data mining/analytics experienceexperience with .net framework- determinationknowledge of data science fundamentals, with experience in implementing them in more advanced areas like machine learning, deep learning, neural networks or recommendation engineshands on data-set experience (extraction >cleaning >analysis >presentation)how to applyemail us your resume and cover letter. in your cover letter, be sure to include something that makes you stand out - what makes you great, and why would you be the best person for this position? we might suggest highlighting something amazing you did, a new idea you had, or an interesting, applicable life experience.in return, we'll offer you the best co-workers there are, an extensive network of well-known people in the startup space, and a competitive salary with stock options. we're flexible in work times/locations.job type: full-time 30+ days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions title: Research Scientist
text: research scientist: caprion career opportunities careers news français accelerating precision medicine™ about us technology proteomics mass spectrometry immune monitoring elispot multiparametric flow cytometry services biomarker discovery clinical laboratory services cellular enumeration functional profiling host cell proteins detection neo-epitope discovery pk/pd assays phenotyping characterization receptor occupancy serological assays (elisa, cba) targeted mrm panels area of research oncology infectious diseases autoimmune disorders allergy quality events hub of science contact research scientist position summary: the research scientist is responsible for ensuring high quality analysis and interpretation of data; he/she performs the analysis of data to ensure scientific integrity, compliance with sop/csp and applicable regulatory requirements. the research scientist works closely with the manager of the data analysis unit, the scientific team and the flow cytometry specialist to address technical/scientific and general project issues; he/she interacts with quality assurance to address quality issues, prepare scientific or technical materials such as reports, manuscripts, and posters along with the scientific team. key responsibilities: performs analysis of data and ensures scientific integrity and compliance with sop/csp; interacts regularly with the manager of the data analysis unit, the scientific team and the flow cytometry specialist to address project issues in a timely manner and to the satisfaction of the client; ensures that all study-related data is appropriately maintained; participates in the development of new in vitro assays as per client needs, including the assay qualification phase; participates in preparation of scientific or technical materials such as interim and final study reports along with the scientific team with the coaching from associate director (scientific team) or senior principal scientist; provides scientific guidance as a high-quality resource person and contributes to the scientific leadership of immunecarta services; performs other duties as assigned. education: master degree in life sciences, preferably in immunology or virology. skills requirements: a minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar position; deep knowledge of human immunology, immune monitoring methodologies and flow cytometry techniques; knowledge and understanding of glp/gclp regulations and other regulatory guidelines sufficient to carry out glp/gclp studies; excellent data analysis and interpretation skills; approaches work methodically and systematically; establishes priorities from among a number of demands; skilled at working in a fast-paced and multi-tasking environment.   interested candidates should send their résumé by email to careers@caprion.com about us about us management board of directors partnerships accreditations & certifications career accreditations & certifications cap accreditation and clia certification quick links about us proteocarta™ immunecarta™ careers news hub of science contact us contact +1 877.776.3443 info@caprion.com north american headquarters +1 514.360.3600+1 877.776.3443 201, avenue président-kennedy, suite 3900 montréal, québec canada european headquarters +32 (0)71 37 85 00 8 rue adrienne bolland 6041 gosselies belgium contact our team follow us

title: Data Scientist
text: data scientist job at plantiga technologies inc. in vancouver, british columbia, canada, powered by jobscore your browser cookies must be enabled in order to apply for this job. please contact support@jobscore.com if you need further instruction on how to do that. data scientist software engineering | vancouver, british columbia, canada | full time job description about us: plantiga is a human analytics company that leverages the fusion of wearable hardware, cloud computing and machine learning to provide real-time predictive analytics for performance, health and safety. the company has developed a novel flexible footwear sensor that produces lab grade gait analytics in a mobile environment. combined with an advanced software back-end, the tiga system is a new type of motion capture. we aim to be the world leader in foot/ground interaction data, and are pioneering “human movement intelligence”. we are looking for a data scientist to join us in changing the world of motion capture and movement analytics. responsibilities: validate and improve the accuracy of plantiga’s algorithms and analytics.  develop novel algorithms that provide value to customers.  create data munging pipeline to clean data for large scale analytics processing.  create ground truth labelled data to infuse human knowledge into our ai platform.  work closely with the upper management to implement projects contributing to product development.  requirements: -- we don't expect them all but here's a good list of what we would love to see -- technical skills:  minimum two years experience in a data scientist / machine learning position.  experienced in machine learning, statistics, and data analytics methods.  working knowledge of digital signal processing such as ffts, filter design, wavelets.  working knowledge of deep learning frameworks and algorithms.  previous experience working with time series data from imus, medical devices, car sensors, or similar.  excellent data visualization skills to communicate knowledge from data.  experience with motion capture and computer vision is a plus.  abilities:  experience taking ideas from conception to release.  critical thinker with an ability to identify root causes of problems.  able to achieve consensus across teams and drive product execution.  thrive in a fast-paced iterative development environment.  highly organized and ability to be self-managed toward assigned tasks.  core competence:  b.sc./m.sc. in mathematics, physics, or engineering disciplines such as computer engineering, mechatronics, engineering physics, applied mathematics.  proficient in scientific computing platforms such as r, python (including numpy, scipy, pandas, matplotlib), or matlab.  experience in a deep learning framework such as tensorflow, theano, torch, etc.  solid understanding of digital signal processing. perks: our office is located in historic railtown, at 611 alexander. it boasts 18" ceilings and brick and beam architecture.  we are a fun group that puts collaboration, good energy and fun above most things. we do beer fridays where friends, family and colleagues can down for a beverage (or two). ‹ › return to plantiga technologies inc. apply for this job apply for this job apply for this job share not the right job? join our talent network return to plantiga technologies inc. powered by hothead games careers - data scientist



























 









                                                    hothead games careers                                            






                data scientist
    
    

                            analytics            
                    vancouver,
                            bc
                
                        



        apply
    


description

hothead games is a 200-person game development studio focused on free-to-play for ios and android devices. millions of people play our games and this generates large amounts of data. transforming this data to make it both meaningful and actionable is a key priority at hothead.we are seeking an ambitious and experienced data scientist to develop advanced data models and analysis methods to assist in optimizing the performance of our games. as the perfect candidate for the position, you have the deep understanding, training and experience in advanced data analysis techniques to further the state-of-the-art at hothead. you excel at solving problems, transforming abstract questions into data models, queries, tests and simulations that deliver measurable outcomes in the financial performance of our games.duties & responsibilitiesmonitor, summarize, and present kpis for a portfolio of gamesprovide cleaned and summarized data to support product decisionscollect, document, and communicate specific data-related questions to internal stakeholders (game producers, designers, marketing, etc.)use statistical techniques with available data to solve relevant company game performance and business problems.plan, design, and develop new models (linear models, glm, survival analysis, arima, feature selection, machine learning, etc.), algorithms, and techniques for data analysis and implement them.advise data analysts on best practices for solving more complex analysis problemsestablish and communicate best practices for analytics-related processes in the companyresearch and evaluate existing game data to discover useful findings for improving financial performance requirementsbachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics or other applied sciencesfluent in with sql, r, tableau, and python.demonstrated competence in statistics, probability, and other relevant areas of mathematicsexperience with big datastrong critical-thinking, problem solving, and communications skillsfamiliarity with free-to-play game design concepts and industry-standard kpis used to measure game performancebonus pointsmobile app industry experience (especially user acquisition)experience with aws and kochavaexperience with hadoop, spark, kinesis, and kafkaexperience with databases like postgresql and mysql this is for a permanent full time position in our vancouver office.  located at 1555 west pender street, vancouver, bc, v6c 2t1. we offer a great compensation package that includes your salary, vacation, extended health, dental and vision care benefits.  some other nice to have’s include an in-house gym, rrsp matching, weekly lunch and learn’s, major/minor league sports event, summer bbqs, snacks, beer and amazing people to work with!

title: Junior Data Scientist
text:
junior data scientist - adlib software - job board go to our website » « go back to job listings junior data scientist location: burlington, ontario, canada department: r&d type: full time min. experience: entry level at adlib, we are redefining the future of content management. we've displaced gorillas in the market with a focus on customer service and success. we are adding to our suite of offerings, building a new product with a unique approach to data insights. like most tech companies, adlib started small, in response to a problem our co-founders experienced as business leaders. they recognized a need for rapidly generated solutions to leverage the value in unstructured data. but unlike most tech companies, those original co-founders continue to be directly involved in the daily operations of the company as ceo, vp r&d and vp customer success. they've built adlib on three pillars of strength that measure our success: product innovation. we build up from our roots, improvising - adlibbing - solutions to client document and data management problems. customer relationships. we have a dedicated focus on creating a positive customer experience that stands out from everyone else. truly engaged and passionate team. that's where you come in. who you are you are obsessed with solving big data problems and determining value of dark data. you want to be fully immersed in an r&d role where you can push the boundaries of knowledge and innovate new solutions to be patented. you are looking for a role where you can leverage your knowledge and our technologies to give meaning and make decisions around unstructured data. you want to use research, natural language processing, machine learning and artificial intelligence to solve data science challenges. you want an opportunity to drive forward the creation of algorithms that will become part of the adlib elevate platform and have a significant impact on thousands of organizations across the globe. there are very few roles like this one out there. our new jr. data scientist will work with: big data. collect, ingest, store and analyze large datasets from structured and unstructured data. transform and convert unstructured dataset into structured data products. best practices. identify and evaluate standardized methods, best practices, models and algorithms to solve the problems. machine learning. research and develop new machine learning techniques and algorithms to address needs. train and build machine learning models to meet goals. experiments. test and validate the solutions. apply the latest technologies in modeling and data mining to the the experiments insights. use data mining techniques and build statistical models to classify and perform data extraction from content. knowledge sharing. document methods and algorithms used in solutions. you will: collaborate. work closely with engineering colleagues to design, build and test new and improved solutions. our new jr. data scientist has: phd in computer science or related field such as mathematics or statistics proven track record of delivering high quality analytics insights and solutions on unstructured data practical expertise using: clustering, regression and classification machine learning techniques data visualization tools distributed big data stores (e.g. hadoop or others) working with tb+ scale datasets statistical modeling, data mining, pattern recognition and search ranking experience designing machine learning pipeline expert knowledge of algorithms and data structures   strong programming skills: python, java, .net or equivalent experience designing, conducting, analyzing and interpreting experiments outstanding critical thinking, creativity, communication and problem solving skills why join adlib? our employees, new and not-so-new, tell us we excel at transparency and work-life balance. and while those may be buzzwords used to attract attention, we actually live them. how do we know this? a significant portion of our team has been here for longer than 10 years. in the tech industry, that's rare. we have people who leave and come back because they miss the culture and our team spirit. but, having said that, we aren't perfect at everything. we're continuously working on change management - we've lost count of how many whiteboards we have. we don't have all of the processes we'd like to, but that means that this is the place to get your hands dirty, come up with your own processes and work without a net. while this might be common in silicon valley, in the suburbs of toronto, it's rare and greatly appreciated to have an open-vacation policy and to promote employee wellness. we have massage therapist days, badminton, baseball, fresh fruit in the lunchroom and fitness membership reimbursement. our burlington, ontario location translates to minimal commute time and maximum family time and productivity time. if you aren't stuck in traffic, worried about being late for a professional or personal commitment, life is just less stressful and work is more enjoyable. adlib software is revolutionizing the way organizations think about their content, join us to be part of that change. apply now or follow us on twitter, facebook or linkedin. adlib seeks to inspire and nurture the human spirit - we understand that each person brings a distinct life experience to the table. embracing diversity not only enhances our work culture but drives business success. adlib encourages applications from everybody, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) privacy & terms
human check* « go back to job listings apply for this position * required fields apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* location phone number* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter* in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye!*   this frame prevents back/forward cache problems in safari.

overview:   the performance analysis consultant is an expert/advisory level position. as performance analysis consultant – customer 360 insights within the journey design & delivery team, this candidate will be reporting to manager, c360 insights. the candidate will be responsible for providing actionable customer insights to resolve strategic and tactical marketing issues by building advanced statistical models using sas, sql and other data mining tools. the role would be expected to provide thought-leadership in researching new modeling techniques/solutions to solve complex marketing issues. along with the manager, c360 insights, the candidate will co-lead the integration of customer insights into telus’ omni channel marketing strategy to enable better decisions that drive revenue/ebitda growth, manage churn and reduce customer effort across various lines of business.   responsibilities:  strategies and planning:  assist the manager, c360 insights to cultivate a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture inside and outside the marketing department and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling process to gain operational efficiency assist the manager, c360 insight to identify business issues through analytics; provide actionable insights and influence business partners to take action based on analytical/modeling insights   thought leadership and teamwork:  contribute to the ongoing development of the team by sharing information, success, lessons learned of own project work collaboratively with marketing primes to develop modelling requirements and prioritization; present model results and actionable recommendations to internal business clients and senior leadership mentors junior team members from a technical as well as business acumen perspective assist the manager, c360 insights to drive for the cultivation of a hybrid culture (analytics and business) to share insights/learnings to demonstrate value of big data analytics and investments to business partner teams (data - insights - strategy - results)   day-to-day portfolio/deliverable management:  contribute to the development of the omni channel strategy by developing near real-time predictive models and trigger based strategies leveraging sas/sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, python, r, etc work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces develop analytical blueprint to solve compartmentalized business issues and assembly to the big picture solution present customer insights to cross functional business partners including marketing, channel, products & services, customer experience and digital own the end-to-end development of campaign targeting through analytics and building propensity models/response models using various multivariate modelling/data mining techniques   expert knowledge:  be recognized as the top expert in predictive modeling, data mining, r&d within telus educate, advocate and advise cross-functional business partners at team member level in advanced analytics and predictive modeling maintain a solid and updated knowledge in the predictive modeling, data mining field including applications of big data, text analytics, social network analytics, cross channel modelling   qualifications required knowledge:  business orientation:  advanced business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills; ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis strong ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables advanced written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of microsoft office suite   technical expertise:  advanced knowledge in various advanced predictive modeling/data mining techniques to ensure effective solutions to marketing issues extensive hands-on experience in sas (or sas enterprise guide), sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, r, python, sql and other data query language on unix/pc and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills    required skills & abilities:  change management: self-driven individual with ability to adapt to varying business environments and effectively drive business results by leveraging analytics mentorship: strong leadership, coaching, mentoring skills  required professional designation/certification:  phd in statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field is preferred master’s degree with extensive relevant experience and knowledge will be strongly considered  required experience:  10+ years of related predictive modeling experience, preferably in marketing telecom/industry experience would be beneficial credit risk modeling experience will be considered  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

job description


ibm global business services: join a leader. consult with us.ibm global business services helps top-tier clients solve their most complex business and technical issues. as a data scientist, you will deliver innovative business consulting, business process design, systems integration, and application design and management to leading sector organizations in 17 industries worldwide. with access to resources that only a global leader can provide, you will learn valuable skills, gain access to a vast and diverse network of talented professionals, and enjoy unparalleled career, training, and educational opportunities.visit http://www.ibm.com/ca/ for more informationthe data scientist will be familiar with key internal and external data sources and how they are gathered and retrieved; experience with manipulation large volumes of data leveraging hadoop and open source technologies is essential. the incumbent will be experienced with various languages and tools and able to select a suitable tool for the analytics solution or working with data.in addition to broad and deep data and analytics skills, the data scientist has strong business acumen, coupled with the ability to communicate findings to both business and it leaders in a way that can influence how an organization approaches a business challenge. incumbents also advise on and select the business problems that have the most value for the organization.a successful candidate must have hands-on experience working with advanced analytics (spss, sas, r) and hadoop big data ecosystem (hdfs, map/reduce, hive, hbase, sqoop, etc.), with an understanding of the following:data mining and business problem definition (experience with crisp dm or similar methodology)analytical and quantitative conceptsmachine learning techniquesdemonstrated ability to learn new tools and solutions quickly

text:
description de l'emploi - data scientist (ds-200917-001-fs)allez à la section du contenu principal.bienvenue. vous n'êtes pas connecté(e)|mes options de comptemon panier|connexionl'accès à ce service est coupé automatiquement après {0} minutes d'inactivité. votre session se terminera dans {1} minutes.cliquez sur ok pour réinitialiser le minuteur à {0} minutes.votre session est terminée.l'accès à ce service est coupé automatiquement après {0} minutes d'inactivité.recherche d'emploismes activitésrecherche de base|recherche avancée|toutes les offresdébut de la section du contenu principal.revenir à la page d'accueilformat imprimable  description de l'emploi - data scientist (ds-200917-001-fs)  data scientist (numéro de l'emploi : ds-200917-001-fs)  groupe bnp paribas bnp paribas possède des succursales dans 75 pays et se targue d’avoir plus de 185 000 employés, dont près de 145 000 en europe. le groupe détient des positions clés dans ses deux grands domaines d’activité : retail banking & services (comprenant domestic markets et international financial services) et corporate & institutional banking. en europe, le groupe dessert quatre marchés intérieurs (la belgique, la france, l’italie et le luxembourg). bnp paribas personal finance est le chef de file du crédit à la consommation. bnp paribas développe également son modèle intégré de banque de détail dans les pays du bassin méditerranéen, en turquie et en europe de l’est et a un réseau important dans l’ouest des états-unis. dans ses activités corporate & institutional banking et international financial services, bnp paribas bénéficie d’un leadership en europe, d’une forte présence dans les amériques, ainsi que d’un dispositif solide et en forte croissance en asie-pacifique.
 
à propos de bnp paribas corporate and institutional banking pleinement intégrée au groupe bnp paribas, bnp paribas corporate and institutional banking (cib) est un important fournisseur de solutions destinées à deux types de clientèle, à savoir les entreprises et les institutions, et exerce ses activités partout en emoa (europe, moyen-orient et afrique), en apac (asie-pacifique) et dans les amériques. la banque est un chef de file mondial sur le marché des capitaux d’emprunt et des instruments dérivés. elle fait partie des plus grandes institutions européennes sur les marchés du capital de risque et détient des franchises de premier plan en financement spécialisé. dans les services en valeurs mobilières, elle compte parmi les cinq premières institutions en importance au monde. bnp paribas cib s’est donnée pour mission de desservir le marché mondial en fournissant un éventail de solutions à ses clients : financement (marchés du capital de risque, marchés des capitaux d’emprunt, financement spécialisé), banque de flux (financement commercial et gestion de trésorerie), services-conseils financiers (fusion et acquisition, financement de projets), marchés mondiaux (taux d’intérêt, crédit, opérations de change, instruments dérivés sur actions), gestion de risques et services en valeurs mobilières.
www.cib.bnpparibas.com
 
description générale le programme d’innovation est sous la responsabilité de l’équipe de la transformation et s’occupe de la gestion et de la coordination de la stratégie d’innovation pour la région des amériques. le programme d’innovation sera une plateforme pour innover et mettre en œuvre des idées qui influencent positivement nos activités et remettent en question le statu quo de l’organisation.sous l’égide du programme d’innovation, un nouveau laboratoire a pour but de soutenir cib dans les amériques et de maximiser la compréhension des clients, des produits, des services et des opérations, ainsi que d'accroître le repérage des occasions à partir de données, de l’innovation et de la conception de produits.les scientifiques de données feront partie d’une équipe centralisée et aideront les dirigeants du laboratoire à analyser les problèmes ou occasions commerciaux et à les résoudre à l’aide d’une analyse approfondie des données. ce poste apportera des méthodes d’analyse et statistiques rigoureuses pour améliorer l’expérience des clients, la stratégie marketing, l’efficacité de la plateforme et l’expérience des employés.
 
responsabilités 
agir à titre d’expert central pour les analyses de données, et constituer une force pour sa mise en œuvre dans bnp paribas dans les amériques :
• découvrir des répétitions cachées dans les données de bnp paribas dans les amériques pour générer de nouvelles occasions de marché et une expérience client améliorée. • appliquer différents modèles statistiques pour trouver les répétitions et effectuer une analyse prévisionnelle afin d'améliorer l’information acquise.• partager ses connaissances sur les tendances technologiques et commerciales pour donner des conseils sur les répercussions et avantages potentiels.• explorer les occasions d’évaluation des données par une analyse améliorée et concevoir/développer des produits à partir des données. • traduire l’information tirée des données en outils et solutions exploitables par les entreprises comme des sources de données centralisées sous une seule interface visuelle, des outils de prévision intelligents, des outils de direction commerciale, des améliorations à la qualité des produits orientés clients de bnp paribas, etc.• assister les initiatives des ti et donner des conseils et des recommandations pour apporter des améliorations le cas échéant.
bnpprsr   compétences minimales requises
• maîtrise en sig, science informatique, statistiques, mathématiques ou autre domaine lié aux ti. un doctorat est un atout.
• au moins 3-5 années d’expérience de travail pertinente (p. ex. : comme statisticien, scientifique de données, bio-informaticien), y compris une grande expertise et expérience en analyse des données statistiques. des travaux d’analyse en dehors des travaux en classe pendant les études peuvent être inclus.
• expertise dans l’analyse des données, science des données et visualisation des données.
• expérience de développement dans un ou plusieurs des principaux langages de programmation analytiques (python, java, c++, etc.).
• expertise dans l’application d’algorithmes d’apprentissage machine (agrégation, réseaux neuronaux, etc.).
• expérience dans l’utilisation de techniques mathématiques pour découvrir des tendances commerciales et pour résoudre des problèmes commerciaux et les traduire en recommandations.
• aptitudes démontrées dans la sélection des bons outils pour résoudre un problème d’analyse des données. 
• excellentes aptitudes de communication verbale et écrite et capacité d’interagir avec professionnalisme. 
• très grande conscience professionnelle; aptitude à traiter les informations confidentielles.

qualifications supplémentaires 
• connaissance des technologies des mégadonnées (hdfs, spark, drill, etc.) un atout.
• capacité d’adaptation rapide à de nouvelles situations et gestion de projets dans un environnement de travail dynamique.
• capacité à dépasser les cadres préétablis en suggérant de nouvelles idées pertinentes pour les clients ou l’organisation.
 
 
une politique de recrutement qui favorise l’équité et la diversité
parce qu’elles favorisent la créativité et l’efficacité, qui sont entre autres sources d’une meilleure performance et d’une plus grande productivité, l’équité et la diversité font partie intégrante de notre politique de recrutement. nous nous efforçons de refléter la société qui nous entoure et d’être à l’image de nos clients.
la règle de non-discrimination s’applique à chacun de nos recrutements. 
nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidats choisis qui répondent aux exigences du poste en matière de formation et d’expérience.
bnpprsr lieu principal: ca-qc-montréaltype d'emploi: cdidomaine d'activité: informatique - secteur d’activité: cib - corporate bankingniveau d'etudes: master ou équivalent (> 4 ans)niveau d'expérience: au moins 3 anshoraire: temps plein

title: 
                        
data scientist
                        










 
requisition id: 1900
the digital factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. we have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward.
do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? at the scotiabank digital factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience.
we’re looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done.
by joining our team, you will make an impact on our customers, the banking industry, and ultimately, the world.
 
 
overview
there has never been a better time to join scotiabank as a data scientist. the data scientist role in the applied analytics team at scotiabank is designed for individuals with a curiosity for deriving insights out of data and applying them to address business opportunities.
 
what’s in it for you?

placement in a bootcamp to introduce candidates to the world of data science at scotiabank
exposure to different business lines where analytics techniques are being applied
assignment in hands-on practical projects which provide an opportunity to gain new knowledge and develop skills
ongoing training and learning program with resources like books, conferences and networking with subject matter experts at analytics user groups organized by decision sciences
a compensation program with competitive salary, opportunities for annual performance incentives based on performance thresholds, a competitive benefits program and continuing education programs. 

 
responsibilities:

collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging data science
ingest massive volumes of structured and unstructured format data, model, transform and store it in variety of data stores
leverage distributed computing tools (e.g. spark, hadoop) for analysis, data mining and modeling
collaborate with data engineering and operational teams to deploy models and algorithms in production, across different channels and customer platforms
create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure conduct multi-variate testing and a/b testing to measure effectiveness of models and make ongoing changes
prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes

 
requirements:

university degree in relevant stem discipline (computer sciences, electrical/computer/software engineering, mathematics)
experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, xml, json, flat files, audio, image)
hands-on experience with big data ecosystem tools (e.g., hive, pig, sqoop, spark, kafka) and experience with nosql databases (e.g., hbase, cassandra, druid)
production experience with experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning and predictive modeling (e.g., cross-sell, upsell, attrition, acquisition and lookalike models)
programming skills in java, c++ or python
experience with common machine learning libraries in r, python, spark
experience with unix tools and shell scripting
solid sql skills for querying relational databases (e.g., sql server, db2, mysql)
experience using and implementing visualization tools like d3, tableau or qlikview

 
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto

what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province data scientist equitysim - toronto, on who we arejoin a small, dynamic team that crushes it on a daily basis. our vision is to create simulation technology that promotes fairness in the hiring processes of all industries. so far, we've built and launched a simulator for the finance industry that can evaluate and place candidates based on their investment strategies. this simulator takes the form of a web platform and extensive backend database of student information and trades.we are headquartered in san francisco, california and like to work hard while having fun. we were recently a member of batch 20 at the 500 startups accelerator program and have successfully raised our seed round of funding. we are still in very early stages, so everyone we employ is very high-impact and needs to make essential decisions on a daily basis.the positioncurrently we are looking for exceptional candidates to join our san francisco, toronto and vancouver offices.we're looking for someone who is comfortable performing in an extremely fast-paced and impactful position. you must be very comfortable owning projects and data and carrying this responsibility. you must also be a very good communicator and be able to set and meet deadlines in an extremely efficient manner.you'll be expected to work with the ceo and technical teams to make improvements to our recruiting algorithm. you'll also work with our data to draw conclusions on user performance, retainability, and other kpis that drive business decisions and the company direction.we're looking for you to use your experience to help integrate new artificial intelligence algorithms into our production software. other responsibilities include:determining what data to collect (and how) to enable us to model expected student performance in the most accurate way possiblefind new ways to track actual behaviors and performance, and compare that to the expected resultsclearly show data comparisons in a transparent manner to draw and support conclusionsworking across technical, sales, and product teams to build and maintain experiments and algorithmsown and improve our most proprietary business algorithmsdetermine the best data collection tools to use, and drive their implementationwho you arean experienced data analyst or scientist with a master's degree in an analytical field, such as computer science, engineering, mathematics, and statistics). we like to see people with interesting, unexpected backgrounds. we're building something totally new and disruptive, so you should appreciate innovation - and all the benefits (and costs) that come with it.specifically, you'll need the following qualifications to succeed:master's degree in an analytical fieldgood personality, willing to work with other good personalities2+ years experience working with scripting languages (python preferred)2+ years of sql experience2+ years of data mining/analytics experienceexperience with .net framework- determinationknowledge of data science fundamentals, with experience in implementing them in more advanced areas like machine learning, deep learning, neural networks or recommendation engineshands on data-set experience (extraction >cleaning >analysis >presentation)how to applyemail us your resume and cover letter. in your cover letter, be sure to include something that makes you stand out - what makes you great, and why would you be the best person for this position? we might suggest highlighting something amazing you did, a new idea you had, or an interesting, applicable life experience.in return, we'll offer you the best co-workers there are, an extensive network of well-known people in the startup space, and a competitive salary with stock options. we're flexible in work times/locations.job type: full-time 30+ days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions title: Research Scientist
text: research scientist: caprion career opportunities careers news français accelerating precision medicine™ about us technology proteomics mass spectrometry immune monitoring elispot multiparametric flow cytometry services biomarker discovery clinical laboratory services cellular enumeration functional profiling host cell proteins detection neo-epitope discovery pk/pd assays phenotyping characterization receptor occupancy serological assays (elisa, cba) targeted mrm panels area of research oncology infectious diseases autoimmune disorders allergy quality events hub of science contact research scientist position summary: the research scientist is responsible for ensuring high quality analysis and interpretation of data; he/she performs the analysis of data to ensure scientific integrity, compliance with sop/csp and applicable regulatory requirements. the research scientist works closely with the manager of the data analysis unit, the scientific team and the flow cytometry specialist to address technical/scientific and general project issues; he/she interacts with quality assurance to address quality issues, prepare scientific or technical materials such as reports, manuscripts, and posters along with the scientific team. key responsibilities: performs analysis of data and ensures scientific integrity and compliance with sop/csp; interacts regularly with the manager of the data analysis unit, the scientific team and the flow cytometry specialist to address project issues in a timely manner and to the satisfaction of the client; ensures that all study-related data is appropriately maintained; participates in the development of new in vitro assays as per client needs, including the assay qualification phase; participates in preparation of scientific or technical materials such as interim and final study reports along with the scientific team with the coaching from associate director (scientific team) or senior principal scientist; provides scientific guidance as a high-quality resource person and contributes to the scientific leadership of immunecarta services; performs other duties as assigned. education: master degree in life sciences, preferably in immunology or virology. skills requirements: a minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar position; deep knowledge of human immunology, immune monitoring methodologies and flow cytometry techniques; knowledge and understanding of glp/gclp regulations and other regulatory guidelines sufficient to carry out glp/gclp studies; excellent data analysis and interpretation skills; approaches work methodically and systematically; establishes priorities from among a number of demands; skilled at working in a fast-paced and multi-tasking environment.   interested candidates should send their résumé by email to careers@caprion.com about us about us management board of directors partnerships accreditations & certifications career accreditations & certifications cap accreditation and clia certification quick links about us proteocarta™ immunecarta™ careers news hub of science contact us contact +1 877.776.3443 info@caprion.com north american headquarters +1 514.360.3600+1 877.776.3443 201, avenue président-kennedy, suite 3900 montréal, québec canada european headquarters +32 (0)71 37 85 00 8 rue adrienne bolland 6041 gosselies belgium contact our team follow us

title: Data Scientist
text: data scientist job at plantiga technologies inc. in vancouver, british columbia, canada, powered by jobscore your browser cookies must be enabled in order to apply for this job. please contact support@jobscore.com if you need further instruction on how to do that. data scientist software engineering | vancouver, british columbia, canada | full time job description about us: plantiga is a human analytics company that leverages the fusion of wearable hardware, cloud computing and machine learning to provide real-time predictive analytics for performance, health and safety. the company has developed a novel flexible footwear sensor that produces lab grade gait analytics in a mobile environment. combined with an advanced software back-end, the tiga system is a new type of motion capture. we aim to be the world leader in foot/ground interaction data, and are pioneering “human movement intelligence”. we are looking for a data scientist to join us in changing the world of motion capture and movement analytics. responsibilities: validate and improve the accuracy of plantiga’s algorithms and analytics.  develop novel algorithms that provide value to customers.  create data munging pipeline to clean data for large scale analytics processing.  create ground truth labelled data to infuse human knowledge into our ai platform.  work closely with the upper management to implement projects contributing to product development.  requirements: -- we don't expect them all but here's a good list of what we would love to see -- technical skills:  minimum two years experience in a data scientist / machine learning position.  experienced in machine learning, statistics, and data analytics methods.  working knowledge of digital signal processing such as ffts, filter design, wavelets.  working knowledge of deep learning frameworks and algorithms.  previous experience working with time series data from imus, medical devices, car sensors, or similar.  excellent data visualization skills to communicate knowledge from data.  experience with motion capture and computer vision is a plus.  abilities:  experience taking ideas from conception to release.  critical thinker with an ability to identify root causes of problems.  able to achieve consensus across teams and drive product execution.  thrive in a fast-paced iterative development environment.  highly organized and ability to be self-managed toward assigned tasks.  core competence:  b.sc./m.sc. in mathematics, physics, or engineering disciplines such as computer engineering, mechatronics, engineering physics, applied mathematics.  proficient in scientific computing platforms such as r, python (including numpy, scipy, pandas, matplotlib), or matlab.  experience in a deep learning framework such as tensorflow, theano, torch, etc.  solid understanding of digital signal processing. perks: our office is located in historic railtown, at 611 alexander. it boasts 18" ceilings and brick and beam architecture.  we are a fun group that puts collaboration, good energy and fun above most things. we do beer fridays where friends, family and colleagues can down for a beverage (or two). ‹ › return to plantiga technologies inc. apply for this job apply for this job apply for this job share not the right job? join our talent network return to plantiga technologies inc. powered by
