hothead games careers - data scientist



























 









                                                    hothead games careers                                            






                data scientist
    
    

                            analytics            
                    vancouver,
                            bc
                
                        



        apply
    


description

hothead games is a 200-person game development studio focused on free-to-play for ios and android devices. millions of people play our games and this generates large amounts of data. transforming this data to make it both meaningful and actionable is a key priority at hothead.we are seeking an ambitious and experienced data scientist to develop advanced data models and analysis methods to assist in optimizing the performance of our games. as the perfect candidate for the position, you have the deep understanding, training and experience in advanced data analysis techniques to further the state-of-the-art at hothead. you excel at solving problems, transforming abstract questions into data models, queries, tests and simulations that deliver measurable outcomes in the financial performance of our games.duties & responsibilitiesmonitor, summarize, and present kpis for a portfolio of gamesprovide cleaned and summarized data to support product decisionscollect, document, and communicate specific data-related questions to internal stakeholders (game producers, designers, marketing, etc.)use statistical techniques with available data to solve relevant company game performance and business problems.plan, design, and develop new models (linear models, glm, survival analysis, arima, feature selection, machine learning, etc.), algorithms, and techniques for data analysis and implement them.advise data analysts on best practices for solving more complex analysis problemsestablish and communicate best practices for analytics-related processes in the companyresearch and evaluate existing game data to discover useful findings for improving financial performance requirementsbachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics or other applied sciencesfluent in with sql, r, tableau, and python.demonstrated competence in statistics, probability, and other relevant areas of mathematicsexperience with big datastrong critical-thinking, problem solving, and communications skillsfamiliarity with free-to-play game design concepts and industry-standard kpis used to measure game performancebonus pointsmobile app industry experience (especially user acquisition)experience with aws and kochavaexperience with hadoop, spark, kinesis, and kafkaexperience with databases like postgresql and mysql this is for a permanent full time position in our vancouver office.  located at 1555 west pender street, vancouver, bc, v6c 2t1. we offer a great compensation package that includes your salary, vacation, extended health, dental and vision care benefits.  some other nice to have’s include an in-house gym, rrsp matching, weekly lunch and learn’s, major/minor league sports event, summer bbqs, snacks, beer and amazing people to work with!

data scientist, data & analytics






toronto, on 


job description


working at kpmg allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. being part of the kpmg global member firm of 155 countries and 174,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. you will work with national and global organizations, adding value and gaining valuable on-the-job experience. at kpmg, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following: help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision making.virtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques read here to know more about: kpmg data & analytics role & responsibilitieswork closely with clients in understanding key business issues. gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutionsutilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. propose and develop results, models and rules engines using statistical, machine learning, natural language processing, linear programming, etc.work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured). investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful algorithms to achieve targeted outcomesperform quantitative analysis of data issuescome to work with an intrinsic desire to change your worldinspire a very smart and talented team to be better at what they already do and innovate in new areaslead engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on problem solving and executionunderstand the business challenge, the data points associated with that scenario and be able to formulate solutions through the application of people, process, technology and databe a thought leader in your area of expertise skills & qualifications:an insatiable curiosity to learn, an aptitude to figure it out and a hunger to make a differencestrong communication and interpersonal skillsability to think critically and laterally – problem solve and innovate within a team environment high level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to perform under pressurepost-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, computer science, or engineering. (candidates with the equivalent of a master’s degree in a relevant subject including, but not limited to mathematics, science, engineering, business administration, marketing, operational research, economics, statistics , ai, computer science or a related field etc. will be preferred.) technical skills:a successful track record of leading large scale data driven engagements within integrated, multi-disciplinary project teamsproven data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of datawell versed with the software development lifecycle, product management, principles of software engineering or data mining methodologiesextensive experience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.)proficiency in scripting (perl, powershell, etc.) experience with programming languages such as (python, java, c, c++, etc.)prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, spotfire, powerbi, etc.experience with hadoop (hdfs, hive, pig, informatica, erwin, etc.), databases (sql server, oracle, etc.), solution definition and application, and  methods (sdlc, pmlc)experience with embedded os for iot is a plusexperience with microsoft hololens is a plusproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and wordhaving fun is key to our productivity and creativity and we provide access to cool relaxation gadgets. we enjoy our work and work hard with a relentless focus on quality and success. at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. #li-143683426_ak1

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual  we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication  we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

title: Data Scientist
text: data scientist job - lixar it - ottawa, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobscompany reviewsfind salariesfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province data scientist lixar it - ottawa, on lixar i.t. is looking for a data scientist to join our data team. as a data scientist, you will be part of a team supporting and participating in the ongoing development of leading edge applications. the ideal candidate will be a senior developer with exposure to programming languages like java, scala, python and r and who has a strong background in cloud development (azure/aws) and data pipelines.as a data scientist, you will have:minimum 3 – 5 years relevant analytics and data mining & modeling work experienceproven ability to develop and execute sophisticated data mining & modeling solutionsin depth knowledge of the advanced techniques and tools common to the data mining & machine learning world such as:clustering, classification, regression analysispython, matlab, rbi visualization tools such as tableau, ms bi, qlikviewhadoop: pig, hive, mapreduce, spark etc.strong attention to detail and excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical abilityworking experience with relational database management system (rdbms); with a strong knowledge of sqlpassionate, energetic, enthusiastic, creativeimpeccable honesty, integrity, and ethicsformally trained or having experience in statistics, computer science, or machine-learning related fieldswhat you will be doing:playing a key role in the creation of sophisticated algorithms, data mining & machine learning strategiessignificantly contributing to the development of lixar’s data offeringfinding creative ways and/or new perspectives on available data to provide value to our customersworking with our research & development team to:apply theories and conduct experiments using available toolsetsprovide input on data mining & machine learning techniquesconduct studies, tests and use advanced data mining & modeling techniques to build solutions that optimize the quality and performance of the company’s dataas the ideal candidate, you:have a sense of humourknow that your routine is in fact, not routinecommunicate exceptionally well with management, peers and clientshave "attention to detail" as your middle namedon’t blame others for your mistakeshave a strong desire for learning something new everydayget things done!job type: full-timerequired experience:data science: 4 years 12 days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to lixar it. apply now other jobs you may like software engineer, data scientist qlik - ottawa, on 9 days ago cloud operations developer mindbridge - ottawa, on 18 days ago easily apply data scientist bank of canada - ottawa, on 12 days ago »see more recommended jobs - 48 new followget job updates from lixar it. by selecting follow, you agree to get updated information and new jobs for this company by email. you can cancel alerts at anytime. about - help centre ©2017 indeed - cookies, privacy and terms

title: Data Scientist
text:
ingrooves music group data scientist | smartrecruiters

data scientistvictoria, canadafull-timecompany descriptionjoin the ingrooves team!at ingrooves music group, we are committed to powering creativity in today’s dynamic music marketplace by providing the best distribution, marketing, and rights management tools and services to content creators and owners. we develop state-of-the-art, cost-efficient, and scalable technology platforms. our partners benefit from our experienced, knowledgeable people, unparalleled commitment to customer service, and thoughtful marketing solutions that drive results. we aspire to be the most transparent and solution-driven partner for all of the labels and artist we work with.what does it take to be successful at ingrooves?success at ingroovesbusiness acumenthe successful candidate aligns with the ingrooves culture by being solution-oriented, collaborative, leveraging best practices, and possessing a passion for both technology and music.interpersonal/communication skillsthe successful candidate will be open minded with a natural curiosity of internal and external customer, delivery oriented with an understanding of the product development process. builds and fosters strong relationships and effective partnerships with cross-functional teams.executing for resultsthe successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to generate and translate strategic plans into actions with timely execution and accountability.leadership/collaborationestablishes and maintains positive working relationships, operates with integrity, influences and supports others, and remains open to ideas.problem solvingthe successful candidate will be tenacious and self-motivated and have a demonstrable record of resolving issues and providing effective solutions. demonstrates eagerness and ability to learn quickly and leverages a flexible mindset in response to shifting dynamics, adversity and/or change.job descriptionthe rolethis is an execution and delivery-oriented, highly visible role in the insights & analytics team with primary responsibility for building, testing, and validating scalable machine learning models that drive business-relevant insight generation. this includes development of project plans, handling of potential issues and risks, collaborating constructively with project team members, providing effective cross-functional communication, and advancing multiple projects at once.the successful candidate will report directly to the evp of insights & analytics and will be based in the victoria bc office.qualificationsdesired qualifications and experience:undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., applied mathematics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, statistics) – graduate degree with a specialty in machine learning/artificial intelligence preferred1 year of data extraction/transformation (e.g., coding with python, scala, java, and analytics with r, sql, pandas, hadoop, hive, spark), and visualization (roc curves, qlik, tableau)knowledge of and practical experience in applying machine learning (decision trees, artificial neural networks, clustering, unsupervised and supervised learning) and developing algorithms and models at scale to solve challenging problemsknowledge of the software design and development lifecycle, tdd, and agile development practicesexperience in a fast-paced, professional services environment is a decided advantagekey responsibilities:build machine learning models and design working algorithms from development through testing and validation from a product-centric perspectiveanalyze gb and tb size datasets to surface and communicate actionable, data-driven recommendations and insightsintegrate with apis and external data sources to uncover statistically robust music consumption trendscreate data-rich visuals and documents to articulate and convey complex concepts to executive leadership team and label partnersother duties as determined by the evp of insights & analyticsadditional informationall your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.videos to watchi'm interestedi'm interestedrefer a friendshare this scientist - adv00053 business analytics is the analytics centre of excellence for canadian operations and is comprised of exceedingly savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are transforming business intelligence at sun life financial (slf) canada. launched in june 2016, the insights and discovery team provides diagnostic analytical services to partners in canadian operations in order to significantly improve the overall value creation potential of business analytics. we are currently looking for a data scientist who has a passion for turning data into actionable insight to drive business decisions. role summary:reporting to the director, insights and discovery, the data scientist will act as a domain expert and lead developer on a range of projects and initiatives for individual solutions clients. working with a diverse and motivated team, the data scientist will work on the development and implementation of predictive models in a fast-paced operational environment in order provide actionable insights and solutions.the insights & discovery team is looking for a team player with a strong quantitative background, a true passion for working with data, and more than 3 years of practical experience from building and implementing predictive models in python, r, sql, java, matlab, sas, or equivalent. flexibility and versatility is key in this role as part of the data scientist’s responsibility will be to connect with clients effectively to insure a successful delivery of the analytical recommendations.main accountabilities:formally applies statistical /scientific rigour to the problems at hand. ensures their work is thoroughly tested and mathematically soundensures that results meet the clients’ needs. makes suggestions to improve the client’s data driven decision-making with statistical methodsexcellent organizational skills to ensure work is documented and transferableshares the responsibility of effectively presenting analytical results and findings to senior business leadersresponsible for ongoing research and development in a continuous improvement environmentcontinues to maintain awareness of relevant trends in the industryacts as a technical team lead on projects when requiredwork with project management leaders by adhering to deadlines and being involved in requirement gatheringcompetencies:minimum of bachelor degree in statistics, computer science, software engineering, mathematics, econometrics, or equivalent. graduate degree preferreddemonstrated data transformation & manipulation experienceknowledge of agile frameworkproficient in c++, java, c#, or scalaextensive programming experience with matlab, sas, r, python or juliafive plus years of experience in statistical analysisknowledge of machine learning methods and big data platforms (hive, spark, hadoop)experience with analysis of unstructured data.practical leadership experience on enterprise projectsassets:insurance or financial services industry experiencegood team playerability to peer review and be self-criticaldesire to push for excellenceability and motivation to work on problemsvalue driven persons

title: Data Scientist
text:
decision resources group - jobs: data scientist - apply online

























all jobs
→
data scientist

data scientist
toronto, ontario, canada · technology development

descriptiondrg is focusing on adding large scale “real-world data” into its business. this is a combination of medical insurance claims data, prescriptions data or information from medical record system covering a large portion of the relevant patient population. in order to effectively manage the billions of records that make up this type of data, drg is building out real world data (rwd) infrastructure based on a distributed computing platform.the data scientist will be focused on analyzing data and developing suitable algorithmic methods for connecting data sets or otherwise refine the information contained in our real-world data assets.role description  perform deep dives into our real-world data assets searching for patterns and insights in specific areas of internal or customer interest develop solutions to real-world data related problems using statistical or algorithm based approaches be part of the team implementing the rwd platform and its capabilities using an iterative approach work with product owner, business analysts, architects and other stakeholders to participate in business requirements and produce technical designs and development plans. communicate complex technical topics to non-technical resources and leadership. provide technical input on alternative approaches to issues that arise.  communicate and enforce coding standards. perform code reviews and support an agile, test driven development methodology.  5-10% travel to subsidiary sites and other locations requirements master's degree in computer science, statistics or related discipline  3+ years of experience in a data analytics / science focused role  expert knowledge in statistics, advanced methods, machine learning and related fields previous experience with distributed computing platforms such as spark or hadoop is a plus. background in using open source technology and databases experience with agile development methodology prior experience working in the healthcare/pharmaceutical or data-driven b-to-b applications is a plus company informationdecision resources group (drg) is a global information and technology services company that provides proprietary data and solutions to the healthcare industry. with over 1,000 employees and 17 offices worldwide, we have brought together best-in-class companies to provide end-to-end solutions to complex challenges in healthcare. our team of highly knowledgeable experts reframe these challenges, enabling our customers to see the opportunities. to learn more, please visit our website at https://decisionresourcesgroup.com.benefitsdecision resources group offers best-in-class, high-value data,  analytics and insights products and services to the healthcare industry,  delivered by more than 1100 employees across 17 global locations. drg  provides the pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device, financial services  and payer industries with the tools, insights and advice they need to  compete and thrive in an increasingly complex and value-based  marketplace. decisionresourcesgroup.com.decision  resources group offers a competitive compensation package and medical,  dental and life insurance programs along with a rrsp match retirement  plan after three continuous months of employment.  decision resources group (drg), in accordance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda), 2005 and the ontario human rights code is committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities during the recruitment process and subsequent employment upon request.  drg will consult with job applicants who have requested accommodation, and who have been invited to participate in the recruitment and/or selection process, on the provision of effective accommodation measures.

title: Data Scientist
text:
data scientist at fiddlehead technology inc.    

























<iframe src="//www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=gtm-t35bkl" height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe>












        fiddlehead technology inc.                








                data scientist    


moncton, nb, canada   
                |   science and research           |   entry level           |   full-time           
            


every year in canada alone, 2.4 billion kilograms of food are wasted in supply chains between farm and fork. that's a big problem to solve in a world that needs to feed 9 billion people by 2050. fiddlehead is a venture-backed startup using data science to help global food and beverage manufacturers make better forecasting decisions. cool fact: there is a 33% chance that any french fry you have eaten in the last year appeared in our statistical models. yep?we love numbers. if you do too, you could be the data scientist we're looking for.the data scientist will work closely with fiddlehead's product team in the development of our modelling engine for forecast and budget performance analytics. we are seeking someone with a solid approach to analytical problem solving who loves to solve hard problems.it's a given that the salary, stock options, and health benefits we provide need to be competitive. we get it. we have families too. what we're offering you is the opportunity to have a big impact on a small team and be well rewarded for it as your role grows along with our company. if you're still reading this, you should send us your résumé to start the conversation. better still? just stop by our office for a chat.  responsibilities

work with engineering and product development to identify and answer important product questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data.identify, clean, and munge new and existing data sources.communicate findings to management team and clients.collaborate with cross-functional team members to rapid prototype new features.estimate tasks and participate in status and stand-up meetings.
qualifications

bs, ba, or advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering or a related field.advanced skills with microsoft excel.a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.working knowledge of an analysis tool such as r, python, matlab, or sas.
core skills

science
problem solving
r
statistics
python
sql
demand forecasting
statistical data analysis
microsoft excel

additional information

nice-to-havesfamiliarity with advanced modelling techniques like random forests, decision trees, support vector machines, and monte carlo simulations.comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.familiarity with relational databases and sql.demonstrable ability to quickly understand new concepts-all the way down to the theorems- and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues.ability and desire to mentor more junior data scientists

title: Data Scientist
text:
tucows careers - data scientist



























 











                                                    tucows careers                                            






                data scientist
    
    

                            analytics & insights            
                    toronto,
                            ontario
                
                        



        apply
    



preamble:tucows is looking to add two data scientists to our analytics & insights team. together, we’re responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, machine learning and related business intelligence operations within the company.  success in this role requires four related components.  the first is that at your core, you are curious.  you live for going down the rabbit hole. chasing mysteries, finding quirks, and peeling back all the layers.  finding new questions to you is almost as fun as answering them, but answer them you do, with solid statistical proof displayed in clear language and compelling visualizations. the second requirement is an ability and interest in understanding our business.   we’ve got lots of data, but it’s not going to turn itself into information, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean.  learning about our business will be made both easy and fun by your deep and passionate love of the internet.  you believe it’s powerfully transformative and even, perhaps, the greatest thing ever.  you can’t wait to be a part of helping tucows make the internet even more awesome. the third component is that you really, for serious­, love math and coding. your arsenal of algorithms is both deep and broad.  you know precisely which tool is right for the job and you also know why.the last, but certainly not least, component is the ability and willingness to continuously learn about new technologies. the data science ecosystem is a fast-evolving beast. newer and more powerful tools are released all the time. you are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.if you have these four qualities, you’ll find tucows an exciting, ambitious and supportive environment in which to do impactful data science work.  main purpose of position:responsible for the provision of information to drive business decision making, via:ongoing collaboration with business specialists to understand drivers and needsanalysis of our unique data sets, including:sales and usage dataweb and social analyticsunstructured text  forecasting and time series data analyticsleveraging existing data sets to provide predictive informationongoing evaluation of available structured and unstructured data setsexperimentation with data to find useful insights application of machine learning (regression, clustering, classification, deep learning etc) processes and techniquesapplication of natural language processing techniques and toolskey position responsibilities/objectives:% of time | description of task / duty25% | responsible for cooperative ongoing dialogue on business requirements for information50% | responsible for self-directed research into available data sets and the various possibilities for extracting information relevant to the business, and for engagement of business functions in the evaluation of results15% | responsible for evolution of tools and techniques for the extraction and delivery of information and insights to internal and external customers10% | responsible for documentation of processes for converting data into information, and training/assistance for internal resources on how best to utilize the resulting reports etc.knowledge, skills & abilitiestop-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skillsexcellent math and statistical analysis skills, especially as they pertain to business and experimentationdeep knowledge and experience of the algorithms and techniques of modern data sciencean interest and proficiency in the presentation and visualization of numbers and statistical dataability to understand business imperatives and drivers, find relevant data correlations, and create processes by which the data correlations are translated to information flows that help drive the business3-5 years of quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reportsknowledge and experience of semantic and sentiment analysis, machine learning and natural language processingcomfortable writing complex sql queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sourcescomfortable using programming languages such as python and/or r to work with data setsexcellent knowledge of microsoft excel and google docsability to document work and effectively prioritize documentationability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and prioritiesnice to haves:experience with hadoop, spark and similar data storage and processing toolsexperience with deep learning methodologiesm.s. or phd, preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field

tucows is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is an equal opportunity employer. if you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

title: Machine Learning Scientist
text:
machine learning scientist - integrate.ai - job board view our website view all jobs ​we're looking for top candidates to join our team! please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications.at integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which ai enriches people’s lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. to do this we are building an ai powered platform for b2c enterprises that integrates with business processes to make customer interactions more natural and valuable. founded by steve irvine, former facebook executive, we are proud to be based in toronto, canada at the centre of an exciting ai ecosystem. machine learning scientist toronto, ontario, canada full time experienced machine learning scientist at integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which ai enriches people’s lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. to do this we are building an ai powered platform for b2c enterprises that integrates with business processes to make customer interactions more natural and valuable. founded by steve irvine, former facebook executive, we are proud to be based in toronto, canada at the center of an exciting ai ecosystem. we're committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. we hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and the freedom to grow into their roles. we are looking  for for experienced machine learning scientists to drive the research and development of statistical and machine learning models that power our ai platform. this is a unique opportunity for someone who wants to grow in the world of machine learning and work with a team of passionate individuals committed to the mission of bringing ml to enterprise. what you will be doing: research, develop, and validate models to generate recommendations, alerts, and other customer insights. research, develop, and validate models to automate customer-facing business processes. perform feature engineering and selection to support machine learning. work with business stakeholders and product manager to translate product requirements into machine learning research and development activities. work with architects and data engineers to gather and clean customer data. conduct statistical inference and unsupervised machine learning to discover trends and correlations. work with architects, data and quality assurance engineers to develop processes, monitoring, and testing automation frameworks to ensure data, insight, and model quality. work with architects and engineers on the delivery of analytical insights into product. document, communicate, and educate customers on product capabilities powered by statistical analysis and machine learning.  you have: 5+ years of hands-on machine learning experience, ideally in a high growth software development environment. a phd or master’s degree in machine learning, applied statistics, operations research, or a related quantitative discipline. deep understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning. passion about deriving insights from large datasets and you can communicate that passion to product managers and engineers. experience in the use of statistical analysis and machine learning tools, packages and languages such as python scikit, r, spark mllib, sas, tensorflow, or mxnet. the diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ai’s team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. we foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. you are naturally curious, invest time to better understand complex concepts and have strong attention to detail. you love working in a team where trust is key and want to make an impact everyday. if this sounds like you, please apply and come work with us. read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* address phone* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye! 150 suppose we have a data set with two variables: type of injury (categorical) and description (string). we want to predict the type of injury for new data given only the description. we get a new description that contains the word “swelling”. our model, built from a very large training sample, tells us that the only two types of injuries that can produce the word “swelling” are “burn”, which occurs in 1 out of 10 observations, and “bruise”, which occurs in 1 out of 100 observations. a “bruise” observation has a 30% chance of generating the word “swelling”, while “burn” has only a 5% chance of generating the word “swelling. without any other information, is the new observation with the word “swelling” more likely to be a burn or a bruise? what is the probability of either?* suppose out of a list of new unlabelled description observations, 6 of them have the word “swelling” in them. what is the probability that at least two of them are bruises?* you have a box of 10 red gumballs and 5 green gumballs. suppose you pick out 5 balls completely at random. what are the chances that they are 2 red and 3 green gumballs?* submit application ×close forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your title: Energy Data Scientist
text: energy data scientist job - energy profiles limited - toronto, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobscompany reviewsfind salariesfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province energy data scientist energy profiles limited - toronto, on about eplat epl, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.we help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.at epl, we combine cloud-based software/analytics with a deep understanding of how buildings use energy to help our clients drive energy savings and reduce their greenhouse gas (ghg) emissions.at the same time, we help our clients manage the complexities of all types of data from utility bills, energy meters, building automation systems, and weather stations (to name a few). we leverage this data to provide trusted and insightful analytics, reporting, forecasting, and planning guidance with respect to both environmental impacts and costs.we develop energy management software. but we know that software doesn’t save energy; software built and continuously improved by smart, motivated people helps our clients – also smart, motivated people - to make good decisions.about the roleenergy data scientists are an integral part of our data systems group. this is our team of engineers, analysts, and developers who both develop and utilize our proprietary software and systems to analyze and report on utility data. as a member of the team you will:apply your expertise to a range of client projects and create meaningful outcomes.create models to analyze how energy consumption at buildings corresponds to weather.load and validate utility data – making it trusted - from various digital sources.prepare monthly and annual energy consumption and cost forecasts based on historical usage and projected utility rates and weather.prepare ghg emissions reports for our clients using recognized industry protocols.analyze, identify and quantify changes to energy consumption at properties.about youyou are smart and act with purpose. you want to be a part of building our team and company.nominally, you have an undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, or another technical field (or equivalent experience).microsoft sql experience is considered an asset. (hint: can you write a join statement?)you demonstrate advanced proficiency in microsoft excel. (hint: can you do an index and match ?)what to expectpeople are the most important part of our company.we have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. the success of our people drives the success of our company.to that end, energy data scientists typically complete several rotations in their first year at epl. each rotation involves doing real work on a different aspect of our business. potential rotations include:building analytics: how is energy used in buildings? where are the opportunities for savings?data science: what are the 5,000 pieces of energy data generated by a skyscraper every day? is the data accurate? what does it tell us?web development: how do we best present information to our clients to drive savings?data integrity: do you know what each line item on your electricity bill means? how do you know if you were billed correctly?forecasting and reporting: what insights do our clients need to help run their businesses?each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their rotations.epl team members also:take unlimited vacationenjoy flexible work hours (our office has time zones!)work with a dynamic team of like-minded people and clientsparticipate in sponsored social events throughout the yearjob type: full-timejob location:toronto, onrequired education:bachelor'srequired language:english 30+ days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to energy profiles limited. apply now other jobs you may like data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 3 hours ago data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 4 hours ago data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 1 day ago easily apply data scientist jla recruiting - toronto, on 9 days ago easily apply senior data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 4 hours ago »see more recommended jobs - 48 new followget job updates from energy profiles limited. by selecting follow, you agree to get updated information and new jobs for this company by email. you can cancel alerts at anytime. energy profiles limited energy profiles limited (epl) is a full service energy software services and engineering firm focused on driving down energy and water use... about - help centre ©2017 indeed - cookies, privacy and terms

data engineer
toronto, ontario, canada · data science

descriptiongale is a business agency headquartered in new york with offices in toronto and bangalore. we’re passionate about delivering data-driven actionable insights, game changing creative, and top-tier technology to fuel great experiences. our team is connected by a set of core values that are important to us, and should be important to you. we’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a belief that our people should be treated like individuals, not resources.we have killer office locations in new york, toronto, and bangalore. we offer an emphasis on growth and professional development, good benefits, and a flexible and fun working environment. we’re looking for great people to join our team!at gale, we believe that being data centric is a core capability we offer to our clients. we are looking for data engineers to join our team of data scientists, developers, and strategists to take our alchemy product to the next level.alchemy is a set of tools that combines data pipelining in java, data science in scala, analytics in r, and reporting in tableau.  together, we use alchemy to generate business insights; enable segmentation, personalization, and recommendations; and track performance. what you will be doing: work with clients and our internal teams to understand the business problem, and develop a data model and pipeline strategy that will help solve the problem use and build out our pipeline framework become a subject matter expert on several clients enable our strategists via reports and dashboards, ad hoc queries, and small r scripts requirementswho you are: 3+ years java or python development 3+ years of experience with sql databases; columnar databases a plus understanding of olap principles such as dimensional modelling familiar with cloud-compute concepts, especially around security passionate about data and extremely detail oriented commitment to producing top quality, well designed and scalable software

date: 
sep 27, 2017
                


location: 
brampton, on, ca, l6t 0c1


every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for canadians. we work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.
 
have a passion for working with big data? imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company whose employees are committed to meeting the big challenges and making a real difference.  that’s rogers.  a leading communications and media company where people come to do great work.  right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters.
 
rogers is currently seeking a highly experienced data scientist to join our big data innovation team.  the data scientist position reports to the director, big data innovation.  the successful candidate will be responsible for developing and maintaining statistical and machine learning models, data transformation flows, reports and visualizations supporting all major rogers business units and key initiatives, including customer experience, brand, it, media, network, consumer and business units and many others.
 
primary function:
 

design, build and deploy robust and effective descriptive and predictive big data statistical and machine learning models and applications
design and build the necessary etl/elt data transformations, reports and visualizations in support of statistical and machine learning models

 
detailed responsibilities include:
 

help define and evolve analytics, predictive modeling and machine learning strategy and roadmap leveraging industry trends, tools and best practices
design, build and deploy robust and effective descriptive and predictive big data statistical and machine learning models and applications
design and build the necessary etl/elt data transformations, reports and visualizations in support of statistical and machine learning models
design, build and test integration interfaces between big data platform and external systems (api-based and other) in support of deploying predictive models
leverage hortonworks hdp hadoop platform, rdbms databases, predictive modeling  and bi tools, saas platforms and apis
build and maintain an expanding set of predictive models supporting various rogers business units
follow the best practices and steps of the predictive modeling lifecycle, monitor the model performance and make ongoing corrections by executing extensive model testing strategies
support poc and lab technology innovation initiatives
work collaboratively with all levels of business and it stakeholders to understand complex data relations and business requirements and implement and test big data models, data transformation and visualization solutions
train and educate it and business teams in the use of big data environment and predictive models to democratize big data capabilities
collaborate with it infrastructure teams in monitoring and capacity planning of the environment ensuring ongoing stability
prepare comprehensive model development and deployment documentation
apply concepts, industry research, best practices and agile methodologies and tools (jira, confluence) to implement big data statistical and machine learning solutions
occasional off-hours work required to troubleshoot production

 
qualifications:

a degree in machine learning, statistics, ai, computer science, engineering, or technology
hadoop developer or data scientist certification (hortonworks preferred)
3+ years of applied statistics, data mining, db marketing or machine learning experience
3+ years of production experience with sas, r or equivalent statistical or ml framework
5+ years of production programming experience with java, scala, python or other languages
5+ years of experience unix/linux shell scripting
excellent understanding of the underlying statistical, machine learning theory and predictive modeling lifecycle
production experience implementing lookalike, clustering decision tree models
production experience with text mining and recommender systems would be an asset
expert-level sql querying skills
in-depth understanding and production experience with the core hadoop components, including hdfs, yarn, mapreduce, tez, hive, pig, spark
minimum 1 year of production hadoop experience. hortonworks hdp 2.2 and above experience is strongly preferred
minimum 1 year of production experience developing hadoop big data applications for etl/elt, analytics, machine learning or reporting
minimum 1 year of production experience with hadoop performance tuning, configuration, optimization, job processing and security
production experience with bi reporting and visualization tools: tableau, oracle obiee, microstrategy
working knowledge of dbms, including oracle (12c), vertica or equivalent
working knowledge of nosql databases such as cassandra, hbase or equivalent
proficiency with source control, continuous integration and testing frameworks
experience working in lean/agile environments is strongly preferred, including working knowledge of jira/confluence
excellent communication (written and oral) and presentation skills

shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 8200 dixie road (101), brampton, on 
travel requirements: none
posting category/function: technology & information technology
requisition id: 96554
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
at rogers, we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers? because we believe the best is yet to come.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.
 
posting notes:  information technology & engineering || canada (ca) || on || brampton || sf:li-km1 ||

date: 
sep 21, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 175002 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with over 137 years of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
 
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
our network team plans, designs, builds and operates bell’s multi-billion dollar networks, including the continued expansion of our fibre optic network, hspa+ and lte —  canada’s largest and fastest wireless network.
 
the service we provide is the foundation of bell’s competitive advantage and a critical step towards achieving bell’s goal to be recognized by customers as canada’s leading communications company.
 
hiring team
the network big data centre of excellence team is accountable for leading data technology and data science initiatives across bell’s network. the team works to design and implement technology strategies and solutions to take advantage of vast amounts of network data spanning wireless, wireline, tv, and media to plan, engineer, and operate bell’s networks and improve our customers’ user experience.
this is a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of a newly established and growing big data devops team and help execute key data and machine learning initiatives. you will have opportunities to apply and grow your data science skills by working with experts in the field and using state of the art data solutions, as well as apply and grow your leadership skills.
 
key responsibilities

lead and participate in the execution of data related use cases with focus on data mining, forecasting, machine learning and ai.
analyze user requirements and create effective and efficient data related solutions
explore and propose solutions to business problems that can be addressed using insights from data
develop data architecture strategies, principles, standards and frameworks. analyzes and evaluates alternative tactical and/or strategic data architecture solutions to meet business requirements
support the growth of the machine learning and ai expertise in the team

 
critical competencies

university degree in engineering, computer science, stats, mathematics. graduate degree in data science related discipline is a strong asset
8+ years of advanced and hands on data experience spanning data modeling, analytics, reporting, forecasting, etc.
hands on machine learning and ai experience
knowledge of the hadoop and hadoop ecosystem components
experience in requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing of software solutions especially data related using r, python and other programming languages
gifted thinker who is extremely resourceful and can learn new technologies on the fly, driven and proactive
strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
autonomous and energetic individual
ability to oversee and work simultaneously on different requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines
strong aptitude to recognize opportunities for improvement in day-to-day work and take appropriate actions
excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills with a strong attention to detail
experience in technology especially telecom networks is a strong asset

 
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : toronto || canada : quebec : montreal
application deadline: 11/30/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.
 
created: canada, on, toronto

06/13/2017






data scientist, data & analytics






toronto, on 


job description


working at kpmg allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. being part of the kpmg global member firm of 155 countries and 174,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. you will work with national and global organizations, adding value and gaining valuable on-the-job experience. at kpmg, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following: help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision making.virtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques read here to know more about: kpmg data & analytics role & responsibilitieswork closely with clients in understanding key business issues. gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutionsutilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. propose and develop results, models and rules engines using statistical, machine learning, natural language processing, linear programming, etc.work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured). investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful algorithms to achieve targeted outcomesperform quantitative analysis of data issuescome to work with an intrinsic desire to change your worldinspire a very smart and talented team to be better at what they already do and innovate in new areaslead engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on problem solving and executionunderstand the business challenge, the data points associated with that scenario and be able to formulate solutions through the application of people, process, technology and databe a thought leader in your area of expertise skills & qualifications:an insatiable curiosity to learn, an aptitude to figure it out and a hunger to make a differencestrong communication and interpersonal skillsability to think critically and laterally – problem solve and innovate within a team environment high level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to perform under pressurepost-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, computer science, or engineering. (candidates with the equivalent of a master’s degree in a relevant subject including, but not limited to mathematics, science, engineering, business administration, marketing, operational research, economics, statistics , ai, computer science or a related field etc. will be preferred.) technical skills:a successful track record of leading large scale data driven engagements within integrated, multi-disciplinary project teamsproven data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of datawell versed with the software development lifecycle, product management, principles of software engineering or data mining methodologiesextensive experience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.)proficiency in scripting (perl, powershell, etc.) experience with programming languages such as (python, java, c, c++, etc.)prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, spotfire, powerbi, etc.experience with hadoop (hdfs, hive, pig, informatica, erwin, etc.), databases (sql server, oracle, etc.), solution definition and application, and  methods (sdlc, pmlc)experience with embedded os for iot is a plusexperience with microsoft hololens is a plusproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and wordhaving fun is key to our productivity and creativity and we provide access to cool relaxation gadgets. we enjoy our work and work hard with a relentless focus on quality and success. at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. #li-143683426_ak1

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual  we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication  we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

text: data scientist job - lixar it - ottawa, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobscompany reviewsfind salariesfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province data scientist lixar it - ottawa, on lixar i.t. is looking for a data scientist to join our data team. as a data scientist, you will be part of a team supporting and participating in the ongoing development of leading edge applications. the ideal candidate will be a senior developer with exposure to programming languages like java, scala, python and r and who has a strong background in cloud development (azure/aws) and data pipelines.as a data scientist, you will have:minimum 3 – 5 years relevant analytics and data mining & modeling work experienceproven ability to develop and execute sophisticated data mining & modeling solutionsin depth knowledge of the advanced techniques and tools common to the data mining & machine learning world such as:clustering, classification, regression analysispython, matlab, rbi visualization tools such as tableau, ms bi, qlikviewhadoop: pig, hive, mapreduce, spark etc.strong attention to detail and excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical abilityworking experience with relational database management system (rdbms); with a strong knowledge of sqlpassionate, energetic, enthusiastic, creativeimpeccable honesty, integrity, and ethicsformally trained or having experience in statistics, computer science, or machine-learning related fieldswhat you will be doing:playing a key role in the creation of sophisticated algorithms, data mining & machine learning strategiessignificantly contributing to the development of lixar’s data offeringfinding creative ways and/or new perspectives on available data to provide value to our customersworking with our research & development team to:apply theories and conduct experiments using available toolsetsprovide input on data mining & machine learning techniquesconduct studies, tests and use advanced data mining & modeling techniques to build solutions that optimize the quality and performance of the company’s dataas the ideal candidate, you:have a sense of humourknow that your routine is in fact, not routinecommunicate exceptionally well with management, peers and clientshave "attention to detail" as your middle namedon’t blame others for your mistakeshave a strong desire for learning something new everydayget things done!job type: full-timerequired experience:data science: 4 years 12 days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to lixar it. apply now other jobs you may like software engineer, data scientist qlik - ottawa, on 9 days ago cloud operations developer mindbridge - ottawa, on 18 days ago easily apply data scientist bank of canada - ottawa, on 12 days ago »see more recommended jobs - 48 new followget job updates from lixar it. by selecting follow, you agree to get updated information and new jobs for this company by email. you can cancel alerts at anytime. about - help centre ©2017 indeed - cookies, privacy and terms

title: Data Scientist
text:
ingrooves music group data scientist | smartrecruiters

data scientistvictoria, canadafull-timecompany descriptionjoin the ingrooves team!at ingrooves music group, we are committed to powering creativity in today’s dynamic music marketplace by providing the best distribution, marketing, and rights management tools and services to content creators and owners. we develop state-of-the-art, cost-efficient, and scalable technology platforms. our partners benefit from our experienced, knowledgeable people, unparalleled commitment to customer service, and thoughtful marketing solutions that drive results. we aspire to be the most transparent and solution-driven partner for all of the labels and artist we work with.what does it take to be successful at ingrooves?success at ingroovesbusiness acumenthe successful candidate aligns with the ingrooves culture by being solution-oriented, collaborative, leveraging best practices, and possessing a passion for both technology and music.interpersonal/communication skillsthe successful candidate will be open minded with a natural curiosity of internal and external customer, delivery oriented with an understanding of the product development process. builds and fosters strong relationships and effective partnerships with cross-functional teams.executing for resultsthe successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to generate and translate strategic plans into actions with timely execution and accountability.leadership/collaborationestablishes and maintains positive working relationships, operates with integrity, influences and supports others, and remains open to ideas.problem solvingthe successful candidate will be tenacious and self-motivated and have a demonstrable record of resolving issues and providing effective solutions. demonstrates eagerness and ability to learn quickly and leverages a flexible mindset in response to shifting dynamics, adversity and/or change.job descriptionthe rolethis is an execution and delivery-oriented, highly visible role in the insights & analytics team with primary responsibility for building, testing, and validating scalable machine learning models that drive business-relevant insight generation. this includes development of project plans, handling of potential issues and risks, collaborating constructively with project team members, providing effective cross-functional communication, and advancing multiple projects at once.the successful candidate will report directly to the evp of insights & analytics and will be based in the victoria bc office.qualificationsdesired qualifications and experience:undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., applied mathematics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, statistics) – graduate degree with a specialty in machine learning/artificial intelligence preferred1 year of data extraction/transformation (e.g., coding with python, scala, java, and analytics with r, sql, pandas, hadoop, hive, spark), and visualization (roc curves, qlik, tableau)knowledge of and practical experience in applying machine learning (decision trees, artificial neural networks, clustering, unsupervised and supervised learning) and developing algorithms and models at scale to solve challenging problemsknowledge of the software design and development lifecycle, tdd, and agile development practicesexperience in a fast-paced, professional services environment is a decided advantagekey responsibilities:build machine learning models and design working algorithms from development through testing and validation from a product-centric perspectiveanalyze gb and tb size datasets to surface and communicate actionable, data-driven recommendations and insightsintegrate with apis and external data sources to uncover statistically robust music consumption trendscreate data-rich visuals and documents to articulate and convey complex concepts to executive leadership team and label partnersother duties as determined by the evp of insights & analyticsadditional informationall your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.videos to watchi'm interestedi'm interestedrefer a friendshare this searchmy jobpagesearch|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprinter-friendly version  job description - data scientist (adv00053)job description data scientist - adv00053 business analytics is the analytics centre of excellence for canadian operations and is comprised of exceedingly savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are transforming business intelligence at sun life financial (slf) canada. launched in june 2016, the insights and discovery team provides diagnostic analytical services to partners in canadian operations in order to significantly improve the overall value creation potential of business analytics. we are currently looking for a data scientist who has a passion for turning data into actionable insight to drive business decisions. role summary:reporting to the director, insights and discovery, the data scientist will act as a domain expert and lead developer on a range of projects and initiatives for individual solutions clients. working with a diverse and motivated team, the data scientist will work on the development and implementation of predictive models in a fast-paced operational environment in order provide actionable insights and solutions.the insights & discovery team is looking for a team player with a strong quantitative background, a true passion for working with data, and more than 3 years of practical experience from building and implementing predictive models in python, r, sql, java, matlab, sas, or equivalent. flexibility and versatility is key in this role as part of the data scientist’s responsibility will be to connect with clients effectively to insure a successful delivery of the analytical recommendations.main accountabilities:formally applies statistical /scientific rigour to the problems at hand. ensures their work is thoroughly tested and mathematically soundensures that results meet the clients’ needs. makes suggestions to improve the client’s data driven decision-making with statistical methodsexcellent organizational skills to ensure work is documented and transferableshares the responsibility of effectively presenting analytical results and findings to senior business leadersresponsible for ongoing research and development in a continuous improvement environmentcontinues to maintain awareness of relevant trends in the industryacts as a technical team lead on projects when requiredwork with project management leaders by adhering to deadlines and being involved in requirement gatheringcompetencies:minimum of bachelor degree in statistics, computer science, software engineering, mathematics, econometrics, or equivalent. graduate degree preferreddemonstrated data transformation & manipulation experienceknowledge of agile frameworkproficient in c++, java, c#, or scalaextensive programming experience with matlab, sas, r, python or juliafive plus years of experience in statistical analysisknowledge of machine learning methods and big data platforms (hive, spark, hadoop)experience with analysis of unstructured data.practical leadership experience on enterprise projectsassets:insurance or financial services industry experiencegood team playerability to peer review and be self-criticaldesire to push for excellenceability and motivation to work on problemsvalue driven persons

needing job postings in an alternative format, may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com

title: Data Scientist
text:
decision resources group - jobs: data scientist - apply online

























all jobs
→
data scientist

data scientist
toronto, ontario, canada · technology development

descriptiondrg is focusing on adding large scale “real-world data” into its business. this is a combination of medical insurance claims data, prescriptions data or information from medical record system covering a large portion of the relevant patient population. in order to effectively manage the billions of records that make up this type of data, drg is building out real world data (rwd) infrastructure based on a distributed computing platform.the data scientist will be focused on analyzing data and developing suitable algorithmic methods for connecting data sets or otherwise refine the information contained in our real-world data assets.role description  perform deep dives into our real-world data assets searching for patterns and insights in specific areas of internal or customer interest develop solutions to real-world data related problems using statistical or algorithm based approaches be part of the team implementing the rwd platform and its capabilities using an iterative approach work with product owner, business analysts, architects and other stakeholders to participate in business requirements and produce technical designs and development plans. communicate complex technical topics to non-technical resources and leadership. provide technical input on alternative approaches to issues that arise.  communicate and enforce coding standards. perform code reviews and support an agile, test driven development methodology.  5-10% travel to subsidiary sites and other locations requirements master's degree in computer science, statistics or related discipline  3+ years of experience in a data analytics / science focused role  expert knowledge in statistics, advanced methods, machine learning and related fields previous experience with distributed computing platforms such as spark or hadoop is a plus. background in using open source technology and databases experience with agile development methodology prior experience working in the healthcare/pharmaceutical or data-driven b-to-b applications is a plus company informationdecision resources group (drg) is a global information and technology services company that provides proprietary data and solutions to the healthcare industry. with over 1,000 employees and 17 offices worldwide, we have brought together best-in-class companies to provide end-to-end solutions to complex challenges in healthcare. our team of highly knowledgeable experts reframe these challenges, enabling our customers to see the opportunities. to learn more, please visit our website at https://decisionresourcesgroup.com.benefitsdecision resources group offers best-in-class, high-value data,  analytics and insights products and services to the healthcare industry,  delivered by more than 1100 employees across 17 global locations. drg  provides the pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device, financial services  and payer industries with the tools, insights and advice they need to  compete and thrive in an increasingly complex and value-based  marketplace. decisionresourcesgroup.com.decision  resources group offers a competitive compensation package and medical,  dental and life insurance programs along with a rrsp match retirement  plan after three continuous months of employment.  decision resources group (drg), in accordance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda), 2005 and the ontario human rights code is committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities during the recruitment process and subsequent employment upon request.  drg will consult with job applicants who have requested accommodation, and who have been invited to participate in the recruitment and/or selection process, on the provision of effective accommodation measures.
